etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Annals and Magazine of Natural History. From ancient Greek ῥιπιδ-, ῥιπίς fan (from ῥιπ-, ῥίψ wickerwork + -ίς) + -o- + ancient Greek γλῶσσα tongue + -ate, after scientific Latin Rhipidoglossa, former order name (F. H. TroschelHandb. der Zool, ed. 3 553; later Rhipidoglossata)

definitions: Designating a flexible and protrusible radula with a band of numerous fine marginal teeth on either side of a central strip of larger teeth, occurring in certain gastropod molluscs.
